page.title: 08A District Nurse's Daily Lot
page.content: The day begins at 8am. with a series of phone calls. Today the first is from a colleague requesting visits to her patients on her day off. A call from a relative asking me to call on her sick husband. Equipment gathered, and the answerphone switched on, away at 8.30am. First to a paralysed lady needing much nursing care; next onto another lady to re-dress her ulcerated leg .Next the surgery, discussing patients' needs, and to collect some dressings. Then a call to give an iron injection, on again to remove post- operative sutures, another injection; help with a bath, more post-operative dressing, followed by reassuring a worried relative. After more calls, home to any recorded messages, writing up patients' notes, and phone calls to doctors etc.Finally equipment and 'black bag' are sorted for tomorrow.
